Internal audit reporting usually contains information on conformity to the given criteria, nonconformities and improvement opportunities. Audit reporting is an essential input for management review. Top management should establish a process for reviewing all internal audit results, in order to identify trends that can require organization-wide corrective actions and opportunities for improvement.
